title: (x) Bodoni-Like 60's Font - Sequel {Mark S}
content:
I've scoured Myfonts for this face, but can't find it – though I've found many like it. Does anyone have an ideas?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130313112540im_/http:/typophile.com/files/shortcut_5430.jpg)
author: woodhousecreative

comments.content:
Well, if you know this is from the 60's that should tell you why finding similar fonts could be hard. Many pre-digital fonts never made it into digital form.

The most similar font I could think of is called [Arbiter](http://web.archive.org/web/20130313112540/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/arbiter-bq/), by Aldo Novarese.

I have scoured the Solotype Catalog, Rookledge's Typefinder and some of my Photo-Lettering books. It has a familiar look, so it's driving me nuts. I think Mark Simonson has a pretty good collection of older type books, and might recognize this.

I am still looking.

- Mike Yanega

Hi Mike,

You're absolutely right, this could be something that never made it into digital form, but, like you, it has a familiar look and I feel like I've seen something very close to it in digital form somewhere. Thanks so much for looking....

--Keith
It's an old film font from the Seventies by TypeSpectra (Phil Martin) called Sequel, and it's been stretched horizontally. I am not aware of a digital version.

Obviously supposed to be "Mark S.". I had a feeling you'd get this Mark. Good job as always.

- Mike Y.
Oops, I’m sorry for being slow off the Mark! You can blame it on the fact that a certain ‘Mike Y’ gets credited with a good deal of all IDs here.
